To the chief Musician, Altaschith, Michtam of David. Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?<RF>Altaschith…: or, Destroy not, A golden Psalm of David<Rf>
Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.
The wicked are estranged from the womb: they go astray as soon as they be born, speaking lies.<RF>as soon…: Heb. from the belly<Rf>

Their poison <FI>is<Fi> like the poison of a serpent: <FI>they are<Fi> like the deaf adder <FI>that<Fi> stoppeth her ear;<RF>like the poison: Heb. according to the likeness, etc<Rf><RF>adder: or, asp<Rf>
Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.<RF>charming…: or, be the charmer never so cunning<Rf><CM>
Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth: break out the great teeth of the young lions, O LORD.
Let them melt away as waters <FI>which<Fi> run continually: <FI>when<Fi> he bendeth <FI>his bow to shoot<Fi> his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.
As a snail <FI>which<Fi> melteth, let <FI>every one of them<Fi> pass away: <FI>like<Fi> the untimely birth of a woman, <FI>that<Fi> they may not see the sun.
Before your pots can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in <FI>his<Fi> wrath.<RF>both…: Heb. as living as wrath<Rf>
The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance: he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
So that a man shall say, Verily <FI>there is<Fi> a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.<RF>a reward…: Heb. fruit of the, etc<Rf><CM>
